title.narrative: OPT 3.3. COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT TO REDUCE, PREVENT AND REPORT VAC

description.narrative: Communities, families, adolescents and children in selected municipalities develop skills to reduce, prevent and report cases of violence, neglect and exploitation., which contributes to Access To Justice, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents victims of violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation are protected by functioning systems, policies and a national legal frameork aligned with international standards, including in emergency situations.

related-activity.ref: 0510/A0/05/403 OCM 3. EVERY CHILD IS PROTECTED FROM VIOLENCE AND EXPLOITATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities, families, adolescents and children in selected municipalities develop skills to reduce, prevent and report cases of violence, neglect and exploitation.

description.narrative: UNICEF has developed holistic, milti-service pilot programmes aimed at supporting families and preventing violence, neglect, abuse and exploitation against children. UNICEF interventions provided support to 2,136 children and adolescents, 247 families, and 123 services providers. They also reached, indirectly, about 10,000 children and adolescents through awareness raising interventions within communities aiming at preventing violence at home and family separation. A variety of interventions come together to ensure sustainable changes in families and communities: development of individual family plans, peer support groups, conducting home visits, and implementing community programmes such as child friendly markets, community volunteers, and community spaces for participation | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2019

title.narrative: # of girls, boys and adolescents who have learned more about preventing and reporting cases of violence, abandonment and exploitation in the selected municipalities

target.value: 2022:5000 in 7 selected municipalities: La Paz, El Alto, Montero, Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Independencia, Cobija, Gonzalo Moreno
